meanings.definition: A person who is inexperienced or inept at a particular activity.
meanings.sent1: The new player was a patzer at chess, often making simple mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The team didn't want to include a patzer in their strategy session.
meanings.sent3: The patzer tried to juggle, but the balls kept falling on his head.
meanings.sent4: In the land of skilled knights, the patzer was a mere squire.
meanings.sent5: The patzer's lack of experience was evident in every move.

meanings.definition: To play poorly or make a mistake in a game or activity.
meanings.sent1: He tends to patzer when under pressure in the final moments of the match.
meanings.sent2: Don't patzer your chances by rushing through the steps.
meanings.sent3: The chef managed to patzer the recipe by adding salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was patzering her way through the dance routine.
meanings.sent5: The musician didn't want to patzer the notes during the concert.
